heading: starcrossed
subheading: actors tom cruise and nicole kidman, taking umbrage at a report in a british tabloid that they needed coaching from sex therapists before they could do their love scenes in the new movie eyes wide shut, filed a defamation lawsuit in a los angeles court. on monday, a judge dismissed a motion by the star to throw out the case, clearing the way for a jury trial. what's the big deal if they did consult the experts? do they think they're the only married couple to need a little, er, help?
author: wired staff
